intro: Urostigma pohlianum, commonly known as the yellow star-of-Bethlehem, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Primulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, yellow star-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its foliage consists of narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often hairy. Urostigma pohlianum is known for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its attractive blooms.
